content.rendered:
Please read these terms of use carefully before using this website

By using the website aqualisbraemar.com (the “Website”), you confirm that you agree to the following terms and conditions (the “Terms of Use”) while using, accessing, browsing or registering to use the Website. If you do not agree to these Terms of Use, you must not use the Website. We reserve the right to change these Terms of Use at any time. Your continued use of the Website after any such changes are published in the Terms of Use will mean you accept the changes.

The Website is owned and operated by AqualisBraemar ASA, a publicly listed company incorporated under the laws of Norway.

These Terms of Use also refer to our Privacy Policy, which sets out the terms on which we process any personal data we collect from you, or that you provide to us. By using the Website, you consent to such processing and you warrant that all data provided by you is accurate.

Investors

The information contained in this Website does not constitute an offer of securities for sale. It must not be relied upon for any investment decision or be treated as an invitation to enter into a contract with you.

The Website and the documents contained on the Website may include “forward-looking statements”. These statements may be identified by the use of words like “anticipate”, “believe”, “estimate”, “expect”, “intend”, “may”, “plan”, “project”, “will”, “should”, “seek” and similar expressions and may refer to, amongst other topics, capital expenditure, cash flows, costs, growth, performance, profits, sales, acquisitions, and strategy. Any such statements reflect our views as of the date made and are subject to risks and uncertainties. We disclaim any responsibility to update forward-looking statements.

Website Content and Rights of Use

We are the owner or the licensee of all rights in the Website, its software, services, functionalities and the material published on it. Those works are protected by copyright laws and treaties around the world. All such rights are reserved.

You may download, view and print any material from the Website for your own personal use. You may not reproduce, modify, copy, distribute, sub-license or publish any part of the Website, including any materials you print or download from the Website, without our prior written consent. Our status (and that of any identified contributors) as the authors of content on the Website must always be acknowledged.

You must not use any part of the content on the Website for commercial purposes without our prior written consent.

If you print, copy or download any part of the Website in breach of these Terms of Use, your right to use the Website will cease immediately and you must, at our option, return or destroy any copies of the materials you have made.

We may update the Website from time to time, and may change the content at any time. However, please note that any of the content on the Website may be out of date at any given time, and we are under no obligation to update it.

We do not guarantee that the Website, or any content on it, will be free from errors or omissions.

Disclaimer of Liability

Although we make reasonable efforts to update the information on the Website, we make no representations, warranties or guarantees, whether express or implied, about the accuracy, completeness or adequacy of the contents of the Website and we expressly disclaim liability for any errors or omissions in the Website contents.

To the extent permitted by law, we exclude all conditions, warranties, representations or other terms which may apply to the Website or any content on it, whether express or implied.

We will not be liable to any user for any direct, indirect, consequential, incidental, special or other loss or damage, whether in contract, tort (including negligence), breach of statutory duty, or otherwise, even if foreseeable, arising under or in connection with the use of, or inability to use, the Website, or the use of or reliance on any content displayed on the Website.

We will not be liable for any loss or damage caused by a virus, distributed denial-of-service attack, or other technologically harmful material that may infect your computer equipment, computer programs, data or other proprietary material due to your use of the Website or to your downloading of any content on it, or on any website linked to it.

We assume no responsibility for the content of any websites linked on the Website. Such links should not be interpreted as endorsement by us of those linked websites. We will not be liable for any loss or damage that may arise from your use of them.

User Account and Uploading Content to the Website

If you create a user account or choose, or are provided with, a user identification code, password or any other piece of information as part of our security procedures, you must treat such information as confidential. You must not disclose it to any third party.

We have the right to disable any user account, identification code or password, whether chosen by you or allocated by us, at any time, if in our reasonable opinion you have failed to comply with any of the provisions of these Terms of Use. If you know or suspect that anyone other than you knows your user identification code or password, you must promptly notify the Webmaster.

Any personal data you provide will be processed in accordance with our Privacy Policy. For all other information you provide or upload to the Website, you agree that we have unlimited rights to such information and that we may use such information in any way we choose. Any such information shall be deemed to be non-confidential and non-proprietary.

You must not misuse the Website by introducing viruses or other material which is technologically harmful or by modifying any content of the Website. You must not attempt to gain unauthorised access to the Website, the server on which the Website is hosted or any server, computer or database connected to the Website. We will report any such breach to the relevant law enforcement officials and cooperate fully with them, including disclosing your identity to them. In the event of such a breach your right to use the Website will terminate immediately.

Governing Law

These Terms of Use shall be governed by and interpreted in accordance with Norwegian law. Any disputes arising under or in connection with the Terms of Use or the Website shall be subject to the sole jurisdiction of the courts of Oslo.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Privacy Policy
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: This policy (together with our Website Terms of Use and any other documents referred to on it) sets out the basis on which any personal data we collect from you, or that you provide to us, will be processed by us. Please read the following carefully to understand our practices…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Newsletter signup
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Subscribe to our newsletter for a quarterly summary of our news & media.

jetpack-related-posts.title: DP FMEA & Audit - Dynamic Positioning
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: We provide an experienced multidisciplinary team of engineering and operational resources to support the DP industry. Aqualis delivers dynamic positioning services including DP FMEA, DP audit, DP Assurance and DP project management.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Jack-up Engineering
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Based primarily in the UK with representatives worldwide, the jack-up team consists of naval architects and structural and geotechnical engineers, who and are jack-up specialists.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Geotechnical Engineering
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Our geotechnical staff are specialists in jack up leg penetration analyses, offshore site investigations, and geotechnical design and installation analysis for offshore oil & gas and wind turbine foundations.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Ports & Harbours, Shipyards & Terminals
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Our Ports & Harbour team specialises in providing Port Capacity and Operational Simulation studies. Utilising our dual-purpose software package BRAEVURA ©, we are able to accurately model existing and future traffic flows using AIS data to predict port capacity, berth utilisations and to assess the effects on marine traffic of…
